intro: Iseilema siamense, commonly known as the Siam velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Iseilema siamense is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
